definitions.definition: a large cover, often made of wool, used especially on beds to keep people warm

examples.text: It’s cold tonight—can I have another blanket?
The baby was wrapped in a blanket.
She pulled the blanket up and went to sleep.
They shivered under their thin blankets.

definitions.definition: a thick layer or mass of something

examples.text: The trial was conducted under a blanket of secrecy.
The sun was breaking through the blanket of mist.
The walls were covered in blankets of ivy.

wordOrigin: Middle English (denoting undyed woollen cloth): via Old Northern French from Old French blanc ‘white’, ultimately of Germanic origin.
